CHAPTER 1-8
FINANCE
1-8-1
WARRANTS
All warrants upon the City Finance Officer that may have been issued and remain
unpaid, or that may hereafter be issued, shall be paid in the order of their presentation.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
SDCL § 9-23-5.
1-8-2
WARRANT REGISTER
The City Finance Officer shall provide and keep a warrants register which shall show in
columns the number, date and amount of each warrant presented, the name of
the
person presenting the warrant, the date notice for payment is made, the amount of
interest and the total amount paid thereon.
Legislative History:   
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
  
SDCL § 9-23-4; Warrant register, 
SDCL §§ 9-23-8, 9-23-9.
1-8-3
REGISTRATION OF WARRANTS
It shall be the duty of the City Finance Officer upon the presentation of any City warrant
for payment, if there are no funds in the treasury to pay the same to enter such warrant
in the warrant register.  He shall thereon place the words "registered for payment", with
the date of such registration, and shall sign such endorsement, and thereafter it shall
draw interest at the legal rate as set by the City Council until paid.
Legislative History:    
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
   
SDCL §§ 9-23-10 through 9-23-12.
1-8-4
NOTICE TO HOLDERS OF WARRANTS
It shall be the duty of the City Finance Officer, as soon as sufficient funds are received
for the payment of the warrants, to pay the first in order on the warrant register and to
notify by mail the holder of such warrant, or in case the holder is not known then the
person that registered it, that the warrant will be paid upon presentation and interest
thereon shall cease.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
SDCL § 9-23-19.
1-8-5
PENALTY FOR NEGLECT
If the City Finance Officer shall fail to register any warrant in the order of its
presentation when presented as provided herein, or shall fail to notify the holder thereof
as provided in § 1-8-2, he shall be liable on his official bond to each and every person,
the payment of whose warrant is thereby delayed, in the sum of fifty dollars ($50.00) to
be recovered in a civil action.
Legislative History:
1990 Revisions.
